text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

Information contained in this document will be used during both the classiﬁcation and examination of tax returns in the National Research Program (NRP). This information describes research material that will be included in NRP case ﬁles.
This IRM content was completely revised and reorganized to reﬂect current NRP and examination processes and procedures. The information was also revised for readability and clarity.
processes and procedures. The information was also revised for readability and clarity. (

) Purpose. This IRM section describes the case building process for tax selected for a National Research Program (NRP) study. (
) The information contained in this IRM provides case building guidance on following studies: • Form
- Individual Income Tax - See IRM
• Form
S - Subchapter S Corporate Tax - See IRM

- Corporate Tax - See IRM

) Audience. This information applies to IRS employees who participate in an NRP study, including: • Classiﬁers • Examiners • Group managers • Reviewers • NRP staff (
) Director, Data Management Division (DMD) under Research, Applied and Statistics (RAAS) is the policy owner. (
) NRP is the program office responsible for oversight of the NRP studies. (
) For information about the National Research Program, visit the NRP at: https://nrp.web.irs.gov. (

) One of the hallmarks of any NRP study is an enhanced focus on case Case building is the process of adding information to the case ﬁle, from IRS and non-IRS sources, prior to classiﬁcation. Use of this information the classiﬁcation process will identify or eliminate potential issues prior to tacting the taxpayer. The NRP approach maximizes the use of data to the IRS and, to the extent possible, minimizes intrusiveness and taxpayer burden. (

) Case building data provides: a. Taxpayer speciﬁc research to identify possible compliance issues for amination. b. A broader working knowledge of the taxpayer’s ﬁnancial activities to an informed decision to accept or examine speciﬁc items on the return. c. Data which can corroborate items on the return to reduce redundancy. (

4.22 National Research Program (NRP)

) Following is a list of the deﬁned terms applicable to case building: a. Case building is the process of collecting information for classiﬁcation and adding information to the case ﬁle from both IRS and non-IRS sources. Use of this information during the classiﬁcation process will identify or eliminate potential issues and provide the examiner with the maximum amount of information to guide the examination activity. b. Classiﬁed Issue List is a list of the classiﬁed issues identiﬁed during classiﬁcation and included in each electronic case ﬁle. For NRP, each issue includes the IMF/SAIN code, issue name, per return amount, schedule, line number and any issue-related comments entered by the classiﬁer. Any case related comments entered by the classiﬁer will also included at the bottom of the document. c. Classiﬁcation is the process of identifying cases and issues for tion. d. Compliance Data Environment (CDE) is a security-certiﬁed, menu database that contains a combination of all transcribed lines from and selected entity information for IMF. CDE does not include all the items of the return; it’s limited to what is transcribed for RTVUE. CDE generates three years of tax return data in a side-by-side tax return so returns are easy to compare. e. Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) is an internal database accessed by various command codes, each of which provides speciﬁc formation about the return and return activity. f. Issue Management System (IMS) is a comprehensive software used by the LB&I Division throughout the examination process to a variety of audit, review and time reporting tasks. g. Report Generation Software (RGS) is a comprehensive software program used throughout the examination process to perform a variety audit and review tasks. In addition to computing tax, penalties and on the examination report, RGS generates correspondence, work and case closing documents. h. Reporting Compliance Case Management System (RCCMS) is a prehensive software program used by the TE/GE Division throughout examination process to perform a variety of audit and review tasks. (

) Following is a list of acronyms relating to case building: a. AIMS – Audit Information Management System b. BMF – Business Master File c. BOD – Business Operating Division d. CBRS – Currency and Banking Retrieval System e. CDE – Compliance Data Environment f. CP – Computer Paragraph g. DCI – Data Capture Instrument h. HHS – Health and Human Services i. MFT – Master File Transactions n. RGS – Report Generation Software o. RCCMS – Reporting Compliance Case Management System p. SAIN – Standard Audit Index Numbers q. ) Case building is the process of adding information from IRS sources to the case ﬁle prior to classiﬁcation and/or examination. Upon completion of the case building process, NRP selected returns are analyzed (classiﬁed) by skilled, well-trained classiﬁers who determine which issues on the return to examine. As discussed in IRM
, classiﬁers will select any and all tionable items to be examined. Once selected, the examiner may not declassify that item. (
) Case building tools help determine which issues to examine. The tools a current overall picture of the taxpayer based on the case building and known data. (

) Case building information is organized in a uniform manner to increase effi- ciency and effectiveness during classiﬁcation and examination. With the number of NRP case ﬁles undergoing examination, it is important the tion under review is presented in a consistent and consolidated format. (
) The assembled case ﬁles are forwarded to the designated Business Division (BOD) for assignment to the groups and NRP trained examiners for audit. (
) NRP is moving towards a fully electronic case ﬁle. Most case building items are included in the electronic ﬁle. (
) The following subsections identify the case building items that will be in the NRP case ﬁles for each type of tax study. • Form

) Following is information about each of the key case building elements appli- cable to speciﬁc NRP case study ﬁles.

Case building information is organized in a uniform manner to increase effi- ciency and effectiveness during classiﬁcation and examination. With the number of NRP case ﬁles undergoing examination, it is important the tion under review is presented in a consistent and consolidated format.
The assembled case ﬁles are forwarded to the designated Business Operating Division (BOD) for assignment to the groups and NRP trained examiners for
Following is information about each of the key case building elements appli- cable to speciﬁc NRP case study ﬁles.
National Research Program (NRP)

National Research Program a. Original Tax Return - Each case ﬁle contains a facsimile of the original tax return, an imaged copy of the original tax return, or a return if e-ﬁled. An imaged copy of the NRP key case return will also be in the electronic case ﬁle. b. Classiﬁed Issue List - Each case ﬁle contains a list of the classiﬁed issues identiﬁed during the classiﬁcation and included in each electronic case ﬁle. This list identiﬁes the issues the examiner is required to examine. c. Information Data Retrieval System (IDRS) - A database, accessed by various command codes, containing return information that, when compared against the ﬁled return, will identify any discrepancies or tionable items. d. Currency and Banking Retrieval System (CBRS) - CBRS provides ﬁnancial information related to reported large cash transactions in of $
Form
, Report of Cash Payments over $

is ated with the transaction, when applicable. e. Compliance Data Environment (CDE) - CDE generates three years of tax return data in a side-by-side tax return format so returns are easy to compare. Three year comparison data enables the examiner to readily changes from year to year but only for identical tax return forms. The print also provides helpful and informative specially calculated ﬁelds. Variances and trends (in income, deductions or other information) can detected through correlation of CDE with other case building data. f. Taxpayer Correspondence (letters, notices, publications) - Letters, notices and publications sent to taxpayers as part of the initial taxpayer contact in every examination. g. CP
(“B” Notice) - This notice provides information on improperly ﬁled

s with an invalid TIN, no TIN or a mismatched TIN. This which is generated electronically, is provided to taxpayers in computer generated letters. h. Data Capture Instruments (DCI) and NRP Lead Sheets - DCI and sheets are used to collect taxpayer and examination data. They are developed by NRP with assistance from subject matter experts. i. Examiner Case Closing Checksheet - This document serves as a for examiners to ensure that all NRP-speciﬁc elements of a case are completed. A completed checksheet is a required part of the case ﬁle all NRP cases. j. Manager Case Closing Checksheet - This document serves as a for managers to ensure the quality of the audit and adherence to NRP- speciﬁc guidelines. A completed checksheet is a required part of the ﬁle on all NRP cases. k. Related Return - These are the tax returns related to the return under examination and any return the taxpayer is responsible for ﬁling or can control. l. Capital IQ - This report provides corporate entity information which includes SEC reports, executive reports and news articles about the company. m. Asset Locator Tool - This commercial tool provides locator and asset formation about individual taxpayers. See IRM
) Enterprise Research Program, for the types of products provided under the current contract.

-TO and Form

Exhibit 4.22.2-1 (09-27-2017) IDRS Command Codes for NRP Case Studies
The following information provides a brief summary of IDRS command codes.
Note: Additional information on IDRS command codes may be found in IRM 2.3, IRM 2.4 and for command code AMDIS, IRM 2.8.3.
code AMDIS, IRM
AMDIS – Provides a summary of all MFT’s and Tax Periods established on AIMS for this TIN.
AMDISA – Provides AIMS examination information for a speciﬁc MFT and Tax Period on AIMS.
BMFOL – Provides research of nationwide entity and tax data information posted to the BMF. Several deﬁners can be used to access speciﬁc tax information from the BMF.
BMFOLA – Displays information summarizing adjustments made to the original BMF tax return (ex- aminations, adjustments, amended returns, etc.).
BMFOLE – Displays entity information for a BMF TIN (name, address, ﬁling requirements, historical information of changes to this data, etc.).

BMFOLI – Displays a summary of all current BMF tax modules for all tax types (income, employ- ment, excise taxes). The summary includes data such as the MFT, tax period, if a return was ﬁled, account balance and freeze codes.
BMFOLR – Displays BMF return information summarized (return ﬁling DLN, cycle posted, income, taxable income, credits, etc.).

BMFOLT – Displays BMF Tax Module (transcript) information including general tax information and tax transactions for a speciﬁc TIN, MFT and Tax Period. Use to analyze the return ﬁling and historic information.
BMFOLU – Displays a reconciliation of the ﬁled
/Schedule H wages and tax to the W-
s ﬁled with Social Security and
-Rs that show taxes withheld. This command code provides a
rec- onciliation report when MFT
is input.
BMFOLU – Provides a
reconciliation report when MFT
is input.
BMFOLZ – Displays a summary of audit history information.

BRTVU – Displays BMF return information. BRTVU provides a display of the transcribed line items on all business tax returns and their accompanying schedules or forms as the returns are processed at the campuses.

DDBKD – Displays information from the SSA, HHS and the IRS for a dependent’s SSN. Displays the person who may be entitled to claim the child indicated on the return, who actually claimed the child, the number of returns on which the child was claimed, and if the child ﬁled a return and claimed their own exemption.
DDBOL – Displays information from the SSA, HHS and the IRS for the possible erroneous claim of a person receiving public assistance.
IMFOLA – Displays information summarizing adjustments made to the original IMF tax return (exami- nations, adjustments, amended returns, etc.).
IMFOLE – Displays entity information for a IMF SSN (name, address, ﬁling status, historical informa- tion of changes to this data, etc.).

IMFOLI - Displays a summary of all current IMF tax modules for the SSN requested. The summary includes data such as the MFT, tax period, if a return was ﬁled and how (electronic/paper), ﬁling status, account balance, freeze codes etc.
IMFOLR – Displays IMF return information summarized (return ﬁling DLN, cycle posted, income, taxable income, credits, etc.).

IMFOLT – Displays IMF Tax Module (transcript) information including general tax information and tax transactions for a speciﬁc TIN, MFT and Tax Period. Use to analyze the return ﬁling and historic in- formation.
INOLES – Displays entity information (names, address, cross reference TIN’s, ﬁling requirements, ﬁling status, etc.).
Exhibit 4.22.2-1 (Cont. 1) (09-27-2017) IDRS Command Codes for NRP Case Studies
INOLEX – Displays Social Security Administration (SSA) name controls, any cross reference tion and merge transaction information (request tax payer spouse’s SSN and it provides the primary SSN).
IRPTRL – Displays IRP (income) information: W-
s, K-
s,
s, etc., online based on a summary income reported by the payer
PMFOLB – Displays a summary of CP
notices used in back-up withholding tax cases.
PMFOLS – Displays Payer Master File (PMF) data for
s, W-
s, etc., issued and total dollars reported. The summary screen shows all sources of income and amounts, withholdings and the number or payer documents ﬁled by the payer as shown on Form
RTVUE – Displays return line items transcribed from Forms

and their accompanying and/or forms as the returns are processed at the Campus. The summary screen shows schedules/ forms for a speciﬁc SSN, MFT and tax period and their respective deﬁner/document codes. It also shows information about income, ﬁling status, tax and payments.
SUMRY – Displays a summary screen showing all modules on IDRS. Use for determining if Collec- tion, the Campus or Criminal Investigation is actively working a case.
INOLEX – Displays Social Security Administration (SSA) name controls, any cross reference informa- tion and merge transaction information (request tax payer spouse’s SSN and it provides the primary
